intro: Fagelia virgata, commonly known as the white sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Fagelia virgata typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
